alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 06 at 1:50PM CDT until June 07 at 3:34PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Verdigris River at Independence affecting Wilson and Montgomery Counties. For the Verdigris River...including Altoona, Independence, Coffeyville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Verdigris River at Independence. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:31 PM CDT Monday the stage was 28.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 30.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Verdigris River Independence 30.0 28.1 Mon 1 pm CDT 26.2 21.3 22.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
